reviewText: Great season just makes you want cell dead by gohans hands all the more but i only gave 4 stars because the packaging is wrong on funimations part the season is 26 episodes but at the bottom of the bluray it clearly states that this is 32 episodes long.
I have bought all of the Blu Rays and can't wait for this one. The new season sets Blu Rays are a must have for any DBZ fan trust me they are really good.

A must buy for anyone interested in this show. The most love Piccolo ever got from the author. Piccolo is many a DBZ fan's favorite character and this is his shining moment where he became stronger than everyone(spoiler educational).

Everything from Cell's introduction to the fight between him and Trunks looks much better in high definition. If you've never seen Dragon Ball Z but you're thinking of checking it out, then I recommend purchasing each season on blu-ray. Great show all the way through.

Huh that's because when star trek was made for tv they weren't no widescreen TV's but we can make it widescreen if you want but we have to cut everyone's heads off ! is that ok with you ? Content: All 9 seasons come with 4 disc.

1080p HD Native
Dolby TrueHD: English Dialogue w/ Japanese Audio Music 5.1
Dolby TrueHD: U.S. English Broadcast Verion 2.0 (With Bruce Falconer OST)
Original Japanese Mono

Ratio is 16x9 (HD Native) NO original DBZ 4:3 Format.

This and the rest of the seasons on Blu-ray are a must have for any hardcore Dragon Ball fan. I usually prefer watching the show dubbed with the original Japanese soundtrack, but I must say that it's pretty cool that you can switch to the 3 different audio tracks as you are watching the show simultaneously.

I really don't think the cropped image is all that noticeable unless you are trying to directly compare it to the original in 4:3 aspect ratio or if you just watched it very recently. Regardless, I think it's something that you can easily adjust to after watching it for awhile.

These releases are a step in the right direction, but NOT PERFECT. MY COMPLETELY UNBIASED review as a day 1 DBZ fan is, EYE do not mind the way the cropping was handled in these new Blu Ray sets AT ALL, they did a great job. Nor do I mind the 16:9 aspect ratio. I prefer that vs. The grain and black bars on the sides of your widescreen TV you'd get with the Dragon Boxes. Due to them being presented in the 4:3 aspect ratio. That being said, I advise holding off on purchasing these new Blu Ray sets mainly because the "Season 6" release is the only release that is presented EXACTLY how all the new Blu Ray releases should have been. Fans should take to Twitter and other outlets you can contact Funimation, and bring these issues to their attention. Ones that mainly exist in seasons 3, and 5, where the colors weren't handled well at all, also some scenes being too bright, and the Green contrast that exists in season 5. I would demand seasons 1-5 be remastered the same way season 6 was; being the sound, picture, color detail etc. EVERYTHING IS PERFECT in the new Season 6 Blu Ray release. LET FUNIMATION KNOW!!!

The sets are great but the value diminishes with each season up to this one. With each season that releases the price increases while the episodes become fewer. Season 5 has been the most expensive one yet costing around $35 until recently while it has the fewest episodes yet with only 26 compared to season 1 which has 39 and since release has only cost $16. I still recommend these sets but that's something to keep in mind.
